intro: Linanthus rosaceus, commonly known as the rose bush larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branched stems. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Linanthus rosaceus is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
